#### Biography
Assistant Professor Matija Mato Škerbić, PhD is a faculty member at the Department of Philosophy and Culture, _Faculty of Croatian Studies, University of Zagreb, Croatia_. He is a pioneer in the fields of philosophy and ethics of sport, and the first to introduce the bioethics of sport in Croatia.
Dr. Škerbić serves as a president of the  _European Association for the Philosophy of Sport._
Dr. Škerbić was the first to earn a PhD in the philosophy of sport from the _Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, University of Zagreb._ In 2019, he defended his dissertation, _William John Morgan’s Ethics of Sport_ , under the mentorship of Prof. Ante Čović, graduating with the highest distinction, summa cum laude.
He is the author of two seminal books: _Philosophy of Sport: Emergence and Development of the Discipline_ (2021) and _Bioethics of Sport: Challenges for the Future of Sports_(2024), both of which are the first of their kind in Croatia and the region. Dr. Škerbić has published over 40 scientific papers, chapters, editorials, and reviews in Croatian and international publications, and is a member of the editorial boards of Philosophical Research and Synthesis Philosophica.
Dr. Škerbić has delivered lectures at more than 70 international conferences, including prestigious events such as the World Congress of Philosophy (Beijing, China, and Rome, Italy), the World Congresses of Philosophy of Sport (Oslo, Norway, 2018; Kyoto, Japan, 2019; Penn State, USA, 2022; and Split, Croatia, 2023), the European Congress of Philosophy of Sport (Paris, France, 2021; Leuven, Belgium, 2023), and meetings of the British Society for the Philosophy of Sport (Oxford, UK, 2019; Swansea, Wales, 2018 and 2022; Aberdeen, Scotland, 2024).
He is the founder and head of the _Research Committee for Bioethics and Sport_(established in 2017) and the _Ethics, Bioethics, and Sport Conference_(initiated in 2018), both groundbreaking initiatives in Croatia and the region. Since 2021, he has been an associate of the _Sport Ethics Colloquium at Pennsylvania State University’s Rock Ethics Institute,_ led by Prof. Francisco Javier Lopez Frias.
In 2023, Dr. Škerbić served as the initiator and president of the Organizing Committee for the 50th World Congress of Philosophy of Sport in Split, Croatia, a collaboration between the University of Zagreb, the University of Split (Faculty of Kinesiology), and the International Federation of Philosophical Societies (FISP). He also serves as the Chair for the Philosophy of Sport Section at the 25th World Congress of Philosophy, Philosophy Across Boundaries, to be held in Rome, Italy, in August 2024.
As an educator, he lectures on philosophy and ethics of sport at the Faculty of Kinesiology (University of Zagreb), the Faculty of Kinesiology (University of Split), University of Mostar (Bosnia and Herzegovina), and the University of Latvia (Riga, Latvia).
Dr. Škerbić is also the author of the first children’s book on ancient philosophers, titled _Philosophy – What the Heck is That?! 13 Stories about Ancient Philosophers_(2019).

Bioetika sporta: prisutnost bioetičkih tema na području filozofije i etike sporta u Hrvatskoj i Srbiji [Bioethics of Sport: share of Bioethical Issues in the Field of Philosophy and Ethics of Sport in Croatia and Serbia], _JAHR- European Journal for Bioethics_ , 9 (2/2018.), pp. 159-184 - co-author Sandra Radenović (Faculty of Sport and Physical education, University of Belgrade, Serbia)

Genome Editing and Selection Based on Genes Associated with Sports Athletic Performance – Some Bio-Ethical Issues, _Synthesis Philosophica_ , 34 (2/2019), pp. 323-340 - co-authors: Zajc Petranović Matea (Institute for Anthropological Research, Zagreb, Croatia), Erhardt, Julija (Faculty of Science, University of Zagreb, Croatia), Jermen, Nataša (The Miroslav Krleža Institute of Lexicography, Department of Lexicography, Zagreb, Croatia), Korać, Petra (Faculty of Science, University of Zagreb, Croatia)
  9. Tjelovježba i igranje-igara u četirima konstrukcijama sretnog ljudskog života. Thomas More, Frane Petrić, Tommaso Campanella i Bernard Herbert Suits [Physical Exercise and Game-Playing in the Four Constructions of Happy Human Life. Thomas More, Franciscus Patricius, Tommaso Campanella and Bernard Herbert Suits], _Filozofska istraživanja_ , No. 39 (2/2019), pp. 335-346

  14. (In)justice on Ice: Valieva and International Sport Governing Bodies’ Justice Duties Toward Underage Athletes, _Sports, Ethics & Philosophy: Journal of the British Philosophy of Sport Association_, 16 (2022), 3; 1-15. – co-authors: Brett Diaz (Toronto University, Canada), Javier Lopez Frias (Penn State University, USA), Marcos Campos (Leuven University, Belgium), Colleen English (Penn State University, USA)

  16. Cyborg-athletes, Pressurization and Integrity of Sport,_FairPlay, Journal of Philosophy, Ethics and Sports Law_ , 1 (2023), 23; 22-39. – co-author Ivana Greguric (University of Zagreb, Croatia) 
  17. Immanuel Kant i filozofija sporta. O iskorištenim i propuštenim prilikama za poantiranje [Immanuel Kant and Philosophy of Sport. About Used and Missed Opportunities for Scoring] //  _Filozofska istraživanja_ , 4 (2024) 44, 723-749 (koautor: Igor Eterović)
  18. [The CMAS code of ethics and the challenges of safeguarding athletes – the Vertical Blue Case](https://karolinum.cz/casopis/auc-kinanthropologica/rocnik-61/cislo-1/clanek-15237) // _AUC KINANTHROPOLOGICA_ 61(2025) 1:32-47 (co-authors: Nenad Dikić, Marija Andjelković, Jim Parry)

#### Professional memberships
**Professional interest:**
**general:** ethics; bioethics; methodology of teaching philosophy and (bio)ethics; philosophy of education; Croatian philosophy and philosophy in Varaždin County
**specific:** philosophy and bio-ethics of sport - internal or intrinsic values of sport; definition and characterisation of sport; normative theories
**Membership:**
Croatian Philosophical Society - Secretary (2018 - 2020); member of International Affairs Committee
Croatian Bioethics Society
International Association for the Philosophy of Sport (IAPS) - a member of the Executive Committee
British Philosophy of Sport Association (BPSA)
European Association for the Philosophy of Sport (EAPS) - president
International Forum of Teachers (IFT) of the UNESCO Chair in Bioethics.
